result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark J Tucker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark J Tucker was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

miscConds.notes: May not possess/use firearms and body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.
May not hold public office.
If not US citizen may face deportation. 
Potential loss of other civil rights until those are restored.

CASES: 14CF228, 14CF135, 13CF397, 13CF382 & 14CF307. Defendant Mark J Tucker in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 4:10 pm.  Exh 1, Exh 2-O&R.  
13CF382-Court enters JOC at this time.  KK/Clerk 4:15PM  

13CF382 - w/held  3 years Probation.  AODA and comply with recommendations.  Sentenced to 196 days - 196 days Sentence credit.  TIME SERVED.  2 yrs IID, 2 yrs Lec rev.  credit for admin susp.  $1219.00 fine/costs bond to be applied. 

14CF135 - w/held 18 months. 

13CF397 - w/held 2yrs prob. Ordered 9 mo conditional time - banked for Probation.  Subject to WR not Subject to GT.  Follow through with COmpas and NO ALcohol.   

All run concurrent with each other.  DNA sample - No surcharge.  He has already given a sample.  Waiving fines 14CF135 and 13CF397.  Refusal is denied.   Must contact Probation tomorrow to let them know that he will be on their roster.  

Elig for CIP and Elig for SA.  May not vote until civil rights are restored.  May not possess/use firearms or body armor.  May not hold public office.  If not US citizen may face deportation. And loss of other civil rights until those are restored.  Court goes over PCR.  adj.   4:55 PM
Sentencing hearing at 03-16-2015 09:00 am
